sentences.english: When Cheng Yi was seven years old, he was very fond of hunting.
sentences.chinese: 程颐十六七岁的时候，非常喜爱打猎。

definition: Cheng Hao (1032-1085), Song neo-Confucian scholar
Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
Shao Yong (1011-1077), Northern Song poet and Rationalist scholar 理學家|理学家
Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
Zhou Dunyi (1017-1073), Song dynasty neo-Confucian scholar
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
science
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Su Xun (1009-1066), Northern Song writer of prose, one of the Three Su 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of Eight Giants 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Dong Zhongshu (179-104 BC), philosopher influential in establishing Confucianism as the established system of values of former Han dynasty
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Li Ao (774-836), Tang dynasty scholar and writer, colleague of Han Yu 韓愈 in promoting classical writing 古文運動|古文运动
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692), wide-ranging scholar of the Ming-Qing transition
